document_title: Stevens Johnson syndrome (SJS): Causes, signs, treatment
subsection_content:
Stevens Johnson syndrome is characterized by ulcers in natural openings of the body such as the eyes, nose, mouth, throat, urinary tract... For women, vulvar and vaginal ulcers can occur. occurs with bleeding. In men, in addition to the usual locations, ulcers can also appear in the urinary tract with symptoms of burning and pain when urinating. Additionally, other symptoms include:
Erythema on the skin; Fever; Muscle pain; Cough; Skin peeling; Drooling (due to difficulty closing the mouth); Conjunctival congestion
